lead_paragraph: Asafa Powell of Jamaica and Jeremy Wariner of the United States broke stadium records at the DN Galan meet in Stockholm yesterday. Powell won the 100 meters in 9.86 seconds. Powell, who shares the world record, 9.77, with Justin Gatlin, surpassed Maurice Greene’s Olympic Stadium record, 9.87, set in 1999. In the 400, Wariner, the Olympic and world champion, ran a 44.02 to break the stadium mark, 44.57, set by Alvin Harrison in 2002.
